section.title: Overview
section.para: can send email's to specified users to alert them when your company receives notifications from the bank; for instance when the bank has accepted your company's Import Letter of Credit request, or has advised your company as an exporter about a new Export Letter of Credit. Alerts can also be sent at chosen milestones, for instance Expiry date or Last Shipment date.

As an administrator at a client company, you use the Alerts module to specify, for a given product and transaction type or milestone date, the users who are to receive alerts. You can specify that an alert be sent to the user who played a specific part in handling the transaction: input, control or release. In this case the email address and the language to use (English or French) are taken from the user's data in the system. Alternatively, you can enter an email address and select the language explicitly. You cannot enter wording for the email. Standard wording is used.
The set of actions for which alerts can be sent is configured by the bank in a system configuration file.

note.para: Additional custom types of alerts (for example, SMS messages) may also be available and configured in this module.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Alerts Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select Administration > Alerts Maintenance.
Alternatively, depending on the Administration function already selected, there may be a link to the Alerts Maintenance function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance Options
section.para: After selecting Administration > Alerts Maintenance from the toolbar, a number of options are provided for Alerts Maintenance in the left side navigation menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Define alerts to be sent when notifications are received from the bank.
Define alerts to be sent when specific milestone dates are reached, passed, or approaching.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance - Submission
section.para: Define alerts to be sent when notifications are received from the bank. When this option is selected, your company details are displayed at the top of the page along with a list of existing Alerts defined for that company.

The list of existing Alerts has the following columns: (Masking character "*" may be used to define all options)
Field
Description
Entity
Entity within your company that this bank counterparty is available to.
This field is present if your company has entities.
Product
Products for which the alert is to be sent.
Sub product
Sub Product for the selected product.
Type
Transaction types for which the alert is to be sent.
Product Status
Status of the product transaction when an alert is to be sent.
Amount
currency and amount greater than or less than conditions that will trigger an alert.
Email Address
The person that should receive the alert.

You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add Alert button at the bottom of the list to add a new alert. The change alert and new alert screens are the same except the fields in the change alert screen are per-populated.

section.para: When you edit an existing alert, or add a new one, you are presented with the following sub form. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

note.para: Be careful not to forget to click Save when you have made your changes. If you simply navigate away from the page, your changes will be lost, even though you have clicked OK on the sub-form(s) where you made the changes and they are shown on the list within the form..

section.title: Alerts Maintenance - Balance
section.para: This option allows the bank administrator to display and define alerts to be sent, when balance reaches specific threshold amount. Bank details are displayed at the top of the page along with a list of existing balance alerts defined for that company.
